name: Healthier Taco Salad
author: Angela
summary: I created this dish so the kids could still enjoy one of their favorite foods, but with less fat and salt. It passed their taste-test with flying colors! Leftovers are great for school lunches.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)
1 (14.5 ounce) package baked tortilla chips, or to taste
1 cup shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese, or to taste
⅓ head iceberg lettuce, shredded, or to taste
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium heat
Cook and stir beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes
Drain and discard grease, and return beef to the skillet
Add tomato juice, hot sauce, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and cayenne pepper
Reduce heat and simmer gently, about 15 minutes
Break tortilla chips into bowls and top with the ground beef mixture
Finish with Cheddar cheese, lettuce, and salsa
